method.name: Symbolic Regression, Grammar-based GAP Algorithm

reference.ref: L. Sánchez, I. Couso. Fuzzy random variables-based modeling with GA-P Algorithms. In R. Yager, B. Bouchon-Menier, L. Zadeh (Eds) Information, Uncertainty and Fusion, Kluwer Editors (2000) 245-256.

generalDescription.objective: To obtain symbolic regression model by means of GA-P algorithms.
generalDescription.howWork: A GA-P algorithm is used to learn a symbolic regression model.

parameterSpec.param: popsize: the number of individuals in the population, GA-P parameter.
numisland: the number of islands or subpopulations, GAP parameter.
steady: indicates how population evolves. A value of 1 forces a steady, while a value of 0 indicates that new individuals substitute old ones. GA-P parameter.
numitera: number of iterations to reach the objectives, GA-P parameter.
toursize: number of individuals selected to tournament selection procedure. GAP parameter.
probmuta: indicates the probability that a mutation operation takes place, GA-P parameter.
amplmuta : the maximum bias that a mutation operation can introduce. GA-P Parameter.
probmigra: probability that an individual of an island is used in a tournament of another island, GA-P parameter.
proboptimlocal: indicates the probability to improve GA-P with local search GA-P parameter.
numoptimlocal: the number of local search steps, GA-P parameter.
idoptimlocal: the local search method used, GA-P parameter.
nichingap: value 1 if niches are going to be used, , GA-P parameter.
maxindniche: maximum number of individual per niche, , GA-P parameter.
probintraniche: probability that a genetic operation can take place with individual of different niches, GA-P parameter.
probcrossga: probability of genetic algorithm (parametric) operations to take place, GA-P parameter.
probmutaga: probability of genetic algorithm (structural) operations to take place, GA-P parameter.
lenchaingap: length of GA-P chain, GA-P parameter.
maxtreeheight: maximum deep of a tree.

method.example:
Problem type: Regression Method: Regr-GAP Dataset: daily-electric-energy Training set: daily-electric-energy-10-1tra.dat Test set: daily-electric-energy-10-1tst.dat Test Show results: StatChekMO Parameters: default parameters but numitera = 5000, maxtreeheight = 6, lenchaingap = 10
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/StatCheckCL/TSTRegr-GAP/ folder the regression results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Model = MSE of all folds: Fold 0 : 0.7648268793390316 Fold 1 : 0.8005379589882445 Fold 2 : 0.8646457297397186 Fold 3 : 0.4877932334613665 Fold 4 : 0.6916876251704424 Fold 5 : 0.4878694897746064 Fold 6 : 0.717171920515642 Fold 7 : 0.4894509534200406 Fold 8 : 0.593787113386939 Fold 9 : 0.5733637746392812 Global MSE: 0.6471134678435313 Global stdev: 0.13247362620661537 TRAIN RESULTS ============ Model = MSE of all folds: Fold 0 : 0.6860894696714795 Fold 1 : 0.6127036955885827 Fold 2 : 0.6789916463860938 Fold 3 : 0.6156187494981954 Fold 4 : 0.6054648697665468 Fold 5 : 0.6361765570690829 Fold 6 : 0.6115362303128338 Fold 7 : 0.6443074429293237 Fold 8 : 0.6182484276045077 Fold 9 : 0.5472041947417166 Global MSE: 0.6256341283568363 Global stdev: 0.037470742177145897
We can see too the output and target classes for each case of the training set (result0s0.tra) in experiment/results/Regr-GAP/daily-electric-energy/:
@relation daily_average_cost_of_tkwhe_electry_energy_in_spain_in_2003 @attribute hidraul real[27881.8,206035.0] @attribute nucleal real[114760.0,187105.0] @attribute carbon real[33537.0,234833.0] @attribute fuel real[0.0,67986.5] @attribute gas real[0.0,84452.2] @attribute regesp real[5307.0,16357.0] @attribute precio real[0.765853,5.11875] @inputs hidraul,nucleal,carbon,fuel,gas,regesp @outputs precio @data 2.31615 2.8867000904620035 2.37613 2.9268884973741582 2.25221 3.030446576218378 2.1057 2.3252409985949734 4.05117 3.167071629012136 2.50409 3.1148809417820784 4.4184 3.3013892556373694 3.07069 3.0272431344918065 1.8168 2.3102239595371636 1.1095 3.1153282831251037 1.42735 2.9543468127131414 3.34136 3.2757607820878976 2.34377 3.062654464862746 ...
And the test results (result0s0.tst) in folder experiment/results/Regr-GAP/daily-electric-energy/:
@relation daily_average_cost_of_tkwhe_electry_energy_in_spain_in_2003 @attribute hidraul real[27881.8,206035.0] @attribute nucleal real[114760.0,187105.0] @attribute carbon real[33537.0,234833.0] @attribute fuel real[0.0,67986.5] @attribute gas real[0.0,84452.2] @attribute regesp real[5307.0,16357.0] @attribute precio real[0.765853,5.11875] @inputs hidraul,nucleal,carbon,fuel,gas,regesp @outputs precio @data 2.21261 2.9731135562638182 3.82169 3.2128973298681043 1.3288 2.722543734986604 2.53167 3.156696394947283 4.00095 3.2473751299649547 2.9788 2.9248588308819765 1.67147 2.96330320161963 3.3829 3.16737053943178 3.19877 2.957202348398799 2.4381 2.9719563888053147 0.960987 2.958383223840262 4.14661 3.3011424585480764 2.32848 3.072879061864798 ...
